revised_title: Mineral Composition and Properties of Otoconia in Vertebrates
tldr: This article investigates the mineral composition and properties of otoconia in vertebrates, focusing on their crystallographic nature and calcium binding properties. Otoconia, found in the gravity receptors of the vestibular labyrinth in most vertebrates, are dynamic mineral deposits with organic and inorganic components. The study reveals that otoconia are composite structures with highly ordered crystallites and suggests that organic material plays a role in calcium ion binding, exchange, and release. The article also discusses the possibility of piezoelectricity in otoconia due to their asymmetrical subunits.
